Steven Dockens joins Renwick as the Art Teacher at Garden Plain High School. We are excited to see this experienced educator help students create their artistic visions. #RenwickProud

This will be my sixth year teaching. Previously I worked with USD 259.

I pursued a career in teaching because ...

I had an amazing art teacher in high school who showed me how rewarding teaching could be.

My hobbies include ...

Art for me is very individualistic. My goal isn't to make everyone create the same thing, but to help you find your passions and assist on making your visions a reality.

Please join us in welcoming Jodie Kerschen to Renwick as a Fifth Grade Teacher at Garden Plain Elementary.

Kerschen, who is no stranger to the community, is extremely excited to be back "home" at Garden Plain.

"I pursued a career in teaching because I have a passion for helping students grow and develop into young, capable adults," she said. "There is nothing I find more rewarding than to see a child be able to solve problems on their own, self advocate, find joy in discovering their passions, and build confidence within themselves."

Kerschen's hobbies include nearly any outdoor activity, traveling with her husband, spending quality time with their son, family game nights, and evenings spent on the patio with friends.

"The most important thing for students to know about me is that I will never give up on them and that they can always come to me for absolutely anything they need," she said.

Welcome "home" to Renwick! #RenwickProud

Smart use of technology
No time and distance barriers; school anytime, anywhere.

Students learn differently.

They bring different experiences to the classroom.

And, they process information in a way that's unique to them.

Fortunately for St. Marks Elementary third graders, teachers Staci Simon and Alayna Klausmeyer meet all of their students where they are.

"They are very flexible in how each student learns and tailor the lessons to the needs of the child," the nomination noted. "They want learning to be a fun and positive experience for every child. They are not afraid to have the difficult conversations with parents because they know it is in the child's best interest."

So why the dual award?

"They have such a great team approach that I cannot just nominate one," the nomination continued. "They are both excellent teachers and wonderful role models for our kids. I cannot say enough about how lucky we are to have them."

We were doubly #RenwickProud to recognize you both at the March 9 Board of Education meeting, and we are so lucky to have you on our staff, Staci and Alayna. Thank you for all you do to ensure each student succeeds!

As a veteran educator, Leslie Bruna continues to do an outstanding job in her classroom.

"But when it comes to building positive relationships with her students, she goes the extra mile to help ALL students especially the ones that need some extra help along the way," said the staff member who anonymously nominated Bruna for one of February's Recognition of Excellence awards. The nomination went on to add that she did a "fantastic job teaching her new "Teaching as a Career class this past fall which I think will continue to grow potential teachers from our district student population."

Thank you, Leslie, for your professionalism and positive attitude that you always brings to work and into the classroom. We are #RenwickProud of you!

When you're getting ready to host Reality U for hundreds of high school students, it takes just a bit of preparation. That's why Director of Curriculum Kati Thul planned to stay late the night before to ensure everything was ready for the educational event the next morning.

"I didn't tell anyone I was setting up and just planned to do it on my own," said Thul. "Scott Fry - the night janitor at Andale Elementary School - Renwick saw what I was doing and pitched in to help set up the 14 tales and chairs in Gym B."

Thul said the act of kindness made a huge difference.

"It was so nice of him to help without being asked," said Thul, who nominated Fry for one of February's Recognition of Excellence awards. Fry is pictured here as he received the honor at the March 9 Board of Education meeting.

Thanks, Scott, for going the extra mile and lending a helping hand. We are #RenwickProud of you!

The Youth Basketball Tournament hosted at Garden Plain High School is no small event.

That's why when staff member Kati Thul noticed a plumbing problem, she didn't hesitate to call GPHS Janitor Andy Kerr.

"One of the bathroom toilets was continuously running," said Thul, who nominated Kerr for one of February's Recognition of Excellence awards. "Andy came up to the building, shut the water off, and returned later that evening to fix the toilet so it could be in use for Sunday."

Thul said Kerr's willingness to help on a weekend was even more evident when he had arrived at the building on Sunday morning by 10, and was already at work refilling bathroom supplies and mopping floors before the Sunday games tipped off.

"I was impressed with Andy's willingness to help, his kindness, and his professionalism. He is definitely a great addition to the GP staff!"

Thank you for being #RenwickProud of our facilities and doing your best -- during the week -- and even on the weekends, Andy. We appreciate you!
